title: 114_hr2111
content: The "Wasteful EPA Programs Elimination Act of 2015" terminates all EPA grant programs, prohibits the use of funds for new ozone standards, and eliminates funding for certain regulations and programs. The "Wasteful EPA Programs Elimination Act of 2015" prohibits the use of Federal funds by the Environmental Protection Agency for various programs related to regulating greenhouse gas emissions and climate resilience initiatives. The "Wasteful EPA Programs Elimination Act of 2015" prohibits the use of Federal funds by the Environmental Protection Agency for programs related to regulating greenhouse gas emissions and climate resilience initiatives, including funding for climate research and initiatives like the Climate Ready Water Utilities Initiative. The Act defines greenhouse gas as carbon dioxide, methane, nitrous oxide, sulfur hexafluoride, hydrofluorocarbons, and perfluorocarbons. SEC. 5 terminates the National Clean Diesel Campaign and environmental justice programs of the EPA. SEC. 6 eliminates EPA regional offices. SEC. 7 requires disposal or leasing of underutilized property. The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency must dispose of or lease underutilized property as identified by the Office of Inspector General. The property must be sold at fair market value, and any costs associated with disposal cannot exceed this value without approval. The property must generate monetary proceeds for the Federal Government. The disposal of real property under this section excludes exchanges, trades, transfers, or non-cash transactions. Other authorities for property disposal remain unaffected, except as specified. Expedited disposal under this section is exempt from certain requirements, including specific sections of the United States Code and other laws.
